definition.@value:
Based on the virus genome sequence there are two clades/variants of the Monkeypox virus, also known as variants, recognised; Clade I and Clade II.
Additionally, it was agreed that the Clade II consists of two subclades; Clade IIa and Clade IIb, with the latter referring primarily to the group of variants largely circulating in the 2022 global outbreak.

label.@value: Clade II of the Monkeypox virus
